lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Johannesburg Stock Exchange president Tony Norton, speaking yesterday before the debt agreement, said the economy was "in bad shape" and there was "an awful lot of talk but little action" to cure serious problems.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Economists said the debt agreement would have no significant impact on economic problems continuing to face South Africa including high rates of inflation and unemployment, labour unrest and political uncertainty.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "They (creditors) asked for the maximum amount and we offered the minimum," said one banking source, reacting to reports from London that creditors were hoping for larger repayments.
